name: A Classification Framework for Function-as-a-Service Platforms
description: A framework for classifying Function-as-a-Service platforms which encompasses 56 review criteria. By default, the criteria are grouped into two views: a higher-level, managerial view and a lower-level, DevOps view.

frameworkViews.name: Managerial View
frameworkViews.description: This view combines higher-level classification criteria focusing on general platform properties such as licence or installation type.

criteria.name: License Name
criteria.description: The name of license under which a platform is released.

criteria.name: License Type
criteria.description: The type of license under which a platform is released.

criteria.name: Installation Type
criteria.description: This criterion indicates how a platform can be installed.

criteria.name: Installation Target Hosts
criteria.description: This criterion indicates to which target hosts a platform can be installed.

criteria.name: Source Code Availability
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a platform's source code is publicly available.

criteria.name: Source Code Repository
criteria.description: This criterion indicates which open source repository contains the source code of a given open source platform.

criteria.name: Main Programming Language
criteria.description: This criterion indicates the main implementation language of a given open source platform.

criteria.name: Interface Types
criteria.description: This criterion indicates which interfaces are provided by a given platform.

criteria.name: Interface Operations for Application Management
criteria.description: This criterion indicates which application management operations are supported by a given platform.

criteria.name: Interface Operations for Platform Administration
criteria.description: This criterion indicates which platform administration operations are supported by a given platform.

criteria.name: GitHub Stars
criteria.description: This criterion indicates how many GitHub stars a given platform has.

criteria.name: GitHub Forks
criteria.description: This criterion indicates how many GitHub forks a given platform has.

criteria.name: GitHub Issues
criteria.description: This criterion indicates how many GitHub issues a given platform has.

criteria.name: GitHub Commits
criteria.description: This criterion indicates how many GitHub commits a given platform has.

criteria.name: GitHub Contributors
criteria.description: This criterion indicates how many GitHub contributors a given platform has.

criteria.name: Stackoverflow Questions
criteria.description: This criterion indicates how many Stackoverflow questions a given platform has.

criteria.name: Platform Documentation
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given platform provides the documentation on how to use and extend it, also including the platform's architecture.

criteria.name: Functions Documentation
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given FaaS platform provides the documentation on how to develop and deploy functions.

frameworkViews.name: DevOps View
frameworkViews.description: This view combines lower-level classification criteria focusing on technical properties such as supported runtimes or event sources.

criteria.name: Function Runtimes
criteria.description: This criterion indicates which function runtimes are supported by a given FaaS platform.

criteria.name: Function Runtime Customization
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given FaaS platform supports runtime customization.

criteria.name: IDEs and Text Editors
criteria.description: This criterion indicates which IDEs and text editor a given platform supports.

criteria.name: Client Libraries
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given platform offers client libraries and in which programming languages.

criteria.name: Deployment Package Size Quota
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given FaaS platform has quotas on the deployment package size.

criteria.name: Execution Time Quota
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given FaaS platform has quotas on the function execution time.

criteria.name: Function Versions
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given FaaS platform supports versioning on the level of functions.

criteria.name: Application Versions
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given FaaS platform supports versioning on the level of application.

criteria.name: Synchronous Endpoint Call
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given FaaS platform supports exposing functions as endpoints for synchronous calls and using which protocols.

criteria.name: Asynchronous Endpoint Call
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given FaaS platform supports exposing functions as endpoints for asynchronous calls and using which protocols.

criteria.name: Endpoint Customization
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given FaaS platform supports exposing functions as endpoints for asynchronous calls and using which protocols.

criteria.name: Endpoint TLS Support
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given FaaS platform supports exposing functions as secure endpoints using TLS.

criteria.name: File Level Data Stores
criteria.description: This criterion indicates which file-level data stores can trigger functions on a given FaaS platform.

criteria.name: Database Mode Data Stores
criteria.description: This criterion indicates which database-mode data stores can trigger functions on a given FaaS platform.

criteria.name: Scheduler
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given FaaS platform supports scheduled function invocation.

criteria.name: Message Queue
criteria.description: This criterion indicates which messaging solutions can trigger functions on a given FaaS platform.

criteria.name: Stream Processing Platform
criteria.description: This criterion indicates which stream processing solutions can trigger functions on a given FaaS platform.

criteria.name: Special Purpose Services
criteria.description: This criterion indicates which special-purpose services can trigger functions on a given FaaS platform.

criteria.name: Event Sources Integration
criteria.description: This criterion indicates how a given FaaS platform enables integration of custom event sources.

criteria.name: Function Orchestrator
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a function orchestrator can be used with a given FaaS platform.

criteria.name: Function Workflows Definition
criteria.description: This criterion indicates how workflow are defined using a given function orchestrator.

criteria.name: Orchestrating Function Languages
criteria.description: This criterion indicates which programming languages can be used to define workflows using a given function orchestrator.

criteria.name: Control Flow Constructs Documentation
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given function orchestrator provides teh documentation on control flow constructs.

criteria.name: Function Workflow Execution Time Quota
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given function orchestrator has quotas on workflow execution time.

criteria.name: Function Workflow Task I/O Size Quota
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given function orchestrator has quotas on workflow tasks' I/O size.

criteria.name: Tools for Functional Testing
criteria.description: This criterion indicates which tools for functional testing a given platform supports.

criteria.name: Tools for Non-Functional Testing
criteria.description: This criterion indicates which tools for non-functional testing a given platform supports.

criteria.name: Local Debugging Tools
criteria.description: This criterion indicates which tools for local debugging a given platform supports.

criteria.name: Remote Debugging Tools
criteria.description: This criterion indicates which tools for remote debugging a given platform supports.

criteria.name: Logging Tools
criteria.description: This criterion indicates which logging tools a given platform supports.

criteria.name: Monitoring Tools
criteria.description: This criterion indicates which monitoring tools a given platform supports.

criteria.name: Tooling Integration
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given platform supports integration of logging and monitoring tools.

criteria.name: Deployment Automation
criteria.description: This criterion indicates which deployment automation tools a given platform supports.

criteria.name: CI/CD Pipelining
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given platform documents support for CI/CD tools.

criteria.name: Function Marketplace
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given FaaS platform has function or application examples available via a function marketplace.

criteria.name: Function Code Sample Repository
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given FaaS platform provides one or more repositories with code samples.

criteria.name: Authentication
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given FaaS platform provides authentication mechanisms

criteria.name: Access Control
criteria.description: This criterion indicates whether a given FaaS platform provides access control mechanisms
